episode_body:
Case: Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022
Client: Muhammad Alif

Client called in this morning - He has police report - He is listed as Unit 3 - He stated that Unit 1 attempted to merge between him & a van in front of him - Unit 1 struck both him & van on passenger side - He has resolved his PD - They totaled his vehicle and he is awaiting the PD check to get a new vehicle - He will be seen at Norton's on Tues - He will also be seeing an ophthalmologist - Stated his right eye has been blurry since the incident - Advised it is highly possible debris or dust entered his eye during incident so initial Eye Exam would be covered with PIP - Advised I would let JC & CS know we spoke this morning and they will get things updated as soon as possible #cc
author: Sarena Tuttle

> frontdesk@ceostx.com> wrote:
>
>> Hi ,
>>
>> We are requesting approval for TBI testing for *MUHAMMED ALIF*, who is a
>> patient of Dr. William Hwang, MD, double board-certified in neurology and
>> psychiatry, with a specialty in physical medicine, rehab, and sleep
>> disorders.
>>
>> Dr. Hwang recommends the following procedures: Oculomotor assessment,
>> Posturography, Neurocognitive testing, Brain Mapping, and MRI/DTI prior to
>> treatment. These tests are performed to better identify traumatic brain
>> injury.
>>
>>
>> -
>>
>> The TBI battery includes:
>> -
>>
>> Oculomotor assessment - $2,000
>> -
>>
>> Neurocognitive testing - $2,200
>> -
>>
>> Posturography this battery - $500
>> -
>>
>> Brain Mapping and Electrophysiology - $8,000
>>
>>
>> -
>>
>> The DTI/MRI - $8,000
>>
>>
>> If you would like to learn more about how multifactorial testing is
>> beneficial for identifying brain injuries please click the following link (
>> http://meet.ceostx.com) to schedule a time to speak with Dr. Matt
>> DeGaetano. If you are unable to find time or would like to speak with him
>> directly please contact him at drmatt@ceostx.com
>>
>> Indications:
>>
>> Oculomotor assessment: brain injury, headaches, fatigue, blurry vision,
>> foggy thinking, reading difficulties, cognitive challenges, balance issues,
>> trouble sleeping, and mood changes blurred vision, double vision, nausea,
>> dizziness, balance problems, unsteadiness, falls, vertigo, spinning
>> sensation, lightheadedness
>>
>>
>>
>> Posturography: brain injury, dizziness, balance problems, unsteadiness,
>> falls, vertigo, spinning sensation, lightheadedness
>>
>>
>>
>> Neurocognitive testing: can help determine the areas of the brain that
>> are impacted by a TBI and how these impairments are impacting your
>> day-to-day functioning. More importantly, testing can also determine how
>> other factors (e.g. depression, anxiety, life stress) are impacting your
>> cognitive functioning, memory loss, lack of concentration, brain fog,
>> irritability, forgetfulness, anxiety, post-traumatic stress.
>>
>>
>>
>> Brain Mapping and Electrophysiology: the most sophisticated,
>> state-of-the-art, real-time imaging/brain training available. Visualize
>> live activity in the Limbic system, anterior cingulate, fusiform gyrus,
>> Brodmann areas, and more by recording 19 channels of brain activity
>> simultaneously. Brain dysfunction can have a variety of causes
>> (encephalopathy), memory loss, lack of concentration, brain fog,
>> irritability, forgetfulness, cognitive decline.
>>
>>
>>
>> DTI/MRI: Diffusion tensor imaging is an MRI technique that uses
>> anisotropic diffusion to estimate the axonal (white matter) organization of
>> the brain. Fiber tractography (FT) is a 3D reconstruction technique to
>> assess neural tracts using data collected by diffusion tensor imaging. A
>> non-invasive medical imaging tool is used to investigate the structure of
>> white matter that is damaged during a Traumatic Brain Injury (TBI) without
>> any neurological symptoms
>>
>> Please reply back accepting or denying requests. *Additionally, please
>> attach a LOP if testing is approved! *
>>
>
>
> --
> Aaron Whaley
> Whaley Law Firm
> 712 Lyndon Ln
> Louisville, KY 40222
> 502-583-4022
>
>

Louisville, KY 40222

These tests are performed to better identify traumatic brain injury. The TBI battery includes: Oculomotor assessment - $2,000
 Neurocognitive testing - $2,200
 Posturography this battery - $500
 Brain Mapping and Electrophysiology - $8,000
 The DTI/MRI - $8,000
 If you would like to learn more about how multifactorial testing is beneficial for identifying brain injuries please click the following link (http://meet.ceostx.com) to schedule a time to speak with Dr. Matt DeGaetano. If you are unable to find time or would like to speak with him directly please contact him at drmatt@ceostx.com Indications: Oculomotor assessment: brain injury, headaches, fatigue, blurry vision, foggy thinking, reading difficulties, cognitive challenges, balance issues, trouble sleeping, and mood changes blurred vision, double vision, nausea, dizziness, balance problems, unsteadiness, falls, vertigo, spinning sensation, lightheadedness Posturography: brain injury, dizziness, balance problems, unsteadiness, falls, vertigo, spinning sensation, lightheadedness Neurocognitive testing: can help determine the areas of the brain that are impacted by a TBI and how these impairments are impacting your day-to-day functioning. More importantly, testing can also determine how other factors (e.g. depression, anxiety, life stress) are impacting your cognitive functioning, memory loss, lack of concentration, brain fog, irritability, forgetfulness, anxiety, post-traumatic stress. Brain Mapping and Electrophysiology: the most sophisticated, state-of-the-art, real-time imaging/brain training available. Visualize live activity in the Limbic system, anterior cingulate, fusiform gyrus, Brodmann areas, and more by recording 19 channels of brain activity simultaneously. Brain dysfunction can have a variety of causes (encephalopathy), memory loss, lack of concentration, brain fog, irritability, forgetfulness, cognitive decline. DTI/MRI: Diffusion tensor imaging is an MRI technique that uses anisotropic diffusion to estimate the axonal (white matter) organization of the brain. Fiber tractography (FT) is a 3D reconstruction technique to assess neural tracts using data collected by diffusion tensor imaging. A non-invasive medical imaging tool is used to investigate the structure of white matter that is damaged during a Traumatic Brain Injury (TBI) without any neurological symptoms Please reply back accepting or denying requests. Additionally, please attach a LOP if testing is approved!

Thank you again for the email,
 We have all of your providers documented and you have confirmed this a
number of times. All records & bills have been requested and we are
awaiting receipt of those records & bills. Providers have a minimum of 30
days to produce these documents.
 I also understand you are wanting policy limits & PIP to be released to
Starlite. Unfortunately, as I have advised each time, the insurance
companies are not required to disclose policy limits prior to a demand
being submitted. A demand can not be submitted until all medical bills &
records are received, which again, have been requested. I further explained
to you & to Gail, Aaron typically also awaits the medical bills for review
before releasing PIP payments as he can determine who receives what amount
of the available benefits. He can not simply release all benefits to a
single provider when you have numerous providers and already $30k just
between 2 of them. I have sent this information over to him to review as
well as the statement that a civil suit is being 'following' or 'filed' on
your behalf. He will reach out to you to discuss this matter further.

On Mon, 13 Feb 2023 06:45:06 -0800 (PST), Axon Medical Centers Admin emailed Sarena:

Case: Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022
Client: Muhammad Alif
__Muhammed Alif Brain Testing Approval__
CC:
Hi ,
 We are requesting approval for TBI testing for MUHAMMED ALIF, who is a patient of Dr. William Hwang, MD, double board-certified in neurology and psychiatry, with a specialty in physical medicine, rehab, and sleep disorders. Dr. Hwang recommends the following procedures: Oculomotor assessment, Posturography, Neurocognitive testing, Brain Mapping, and MRI/DTI prior to treatment. These tests are performed to better identify traumatic brain injury. The TBI battery includes:Oculomotor assessment - $2,000Neurocognitive testing - $2,200Posturography this battery - $500Brain Mapping and Electrophysiology - $8,000The DTI/MRI - $8,000If you would like to learn more about how multifactorial testing is beneficial for identifying brain injuries please click the following link (http://meet.ceostx.com) to schedule a time to speak with Dr. Matt DeGaetano. If you are unable to find time or would like to speak with him directly please contact him at drmatt@ceostx.com Indications: Oculomotor assessment: brain injury, headaches, fatigue, blurry vision, foggy thinking, reading difficulties, cognitive challenges, balance issues, trouble sleeping, and mood changes blurred vision, double vision, nausea, dizziness, balance problems, unsteadiness, falls, vertigo, spinning sensation, lightheadedness Posturography: brain injury, dizziness, balance problems, unsteadiness, falls, vertigo, spinning sensation, lightheadedness Neurocognitive testing: can help determine the areas of the brain that are impacted by a TBI and how these impairments are impacting your day-to-day functioning. More importantly, testing can also determine how other factors (e.g. depression, anxiety, life stress) are impacting your cognitive functioning, memory loss, lack of concentration, brain fog, irritability, forgetfulness, anxiety, post-traumatic stress. Brain Mapping and Electrophysiology: the most sophisticated, state-of-the-art, real-time imaging/brain training available. Visualize live activity in the Limbic system, anterior cingulate, fusiform gyrus, Brodmann areas, and more by recording 19 channels of brain activity simultaneously. Brain dysfunction can have a variety of causes (encephalopathy), memory loss, lack of concentration, brain fog, irritability, forgetfulness, cognitive decline. DTI/MRI: Diffusion tensor imaging is an MRI technique that uses anisotropic diffusion to estimate the axonal (white matter) organization of the brain. Fiber tractography (FT) is a 3D reconstruction technique to assess neural tracts using data collected by diffusion tensor imaging. A non-invasive medical imaging tool is used to investigate the structure of white matter that is damaged during a Traumatic Brain Injury (TBI) without any neurological symptoms
 ---Administration Axon Medical CentersDallas | Houston | San Antonio | El Paso | AustinPhone: 855-296-6824The information contained in this transmission may contain privileged and confidential information, including patient information protected by federal and state privacy laws. It is intended only for the use of the person(s) named above. If you are not the intended recipient, you are hereby notified that any review, dissemination, distribution, or duplication of this communication is strictly prohibited and we ask that you please contact the sender via email: admin@amctbi.com or telephone 855-296-6824 and destroy all copies of the original message
 Please reply back accepting or denying requests. Additionally, please attach a LOP if testing is approved!

Good morning Mo,
 Thank you for the email. While we understand your concern, filing suit
is not a proper process for your claims at this time. The Bodily Injury
Carrier for your claims have accepted liability and we are simply awaiting
you to complete treatment. Once you have completed treatment and all of
your records & bills have been obtained, we will proceed with the proper
Demand Process. IF during the negotiation phase of the claim, your bodily
injury carrier is not willing to make a reasonable offer, your attorney,
Aaron Whaley, will review the file for litigation. Please understand that
litigation is a very expensive and lengthy process and should not be taken
lightly, at this time, we will not be filing a civil suit. If you have any
other questions, please do not hesitate to contact us directly to discuss
them in further detail.

episode_body:
On Tue, 14 Feb 2023 13:57:56 -0500, Aaron Whaley emailed Muhammad Alif:

Case: Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022
Client: Muhammad Alif
__Re: Filing a lawsuit__
CC:
I understand. I spoke to the adjuster and they are not disclosing limits
because in the adjuster's words "there is not a concern that this claim
will exceed the limits". She said it is a commercial policy and they have
sufficient limits. I assume they have at least $500,000, likely
$1,000,000. If you want to file a lawsuit we can. I will tell you what I
tell everyone. Lawsuits are not fast. If you are wanting speed then a
lawsuit is not fast. Lawsuits are, however, certain. That is what you get
with a suit. I don't usually like to file a lawsuit unless there is some
sort of impasse. Either there is a liability dispute or a dispute over
value that exceeds the cost of litigation. We are not to either of these.
There is some merit in filing suit now if we think one of these disputes is
inevitable. But, if we do and it turns out that they are on board with our
way of thinking that will not necessarily get us out of litigation. Defense
counsel will almost certainly want to be involved and complete discovery,
depositions etc.
So in short. Litigation is long and costly but we get to an eventual
resolution. Pre-litigation is shorter and cheaper but we may not resolve
the case and end up in litigation anyway.
I will leave it up to you with this information.

On Thu, 9 Mar 2023 12:38:58 -0800 (PST), Axon Medical Centers Admin emailed Muhammad Alif:

Case: Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022
Client: Muhammad Alif
__Muhammad Alif Brain Testing Approval__
CC:
Hi,
 We are requesting approval for TBI testing for Muhammad Alif, who is a patient of Dr. William Hwang, MD, double board-certified in neurology and psychiatry, with a specialty in physical medicine, rehab, and sleep disorders. Dr. Hwang recommends the following procedures: Brain Mapping, and MRI/DTI prior to treatment. These tests are performed to better identify traumatic brain injury. The TBI battery includes:Brain Mapping and Electrophysiology - $8,000The DTI/MRI - $8,000If you would like to learn more about how multifactorial testing is beneficial for identifying brain injuries please click the following link (http://meet.ceostx.com) to schedule a time to speak with Dr. Matt DeGaetano. If you are unable to find time or would like to speak with him directly please contact him at drmatt@ceostx.com Indications: Brain Mapping and Electrophysiology: the most sophisticated, state-of-the-art, real-time imaging/brain training available. Visualize live activity in the Limbic system, anterior cingulate, fusiform gyrus, Brodmann areas, and more by recording 19 channels of brain activity simultaneously. Brain dysfunction can have a variety of causes (encephalopathy), memory loss, lack of concentration, brain fog, irritability, forgetfulness, cognitive decline. DTI/MRI: Diffusion tensor imaging is an MRI technique that uses anisotropic diffusion to estimate the axonal (white matter) organization of the brain. Fiber tractography (FT) is a 3D reconstruction technique to assess neural tracts using data collected by diffusion tensor imaging. A non-invasive medical imaging tool is used to investigate the structure of white matter that is damaged during a Traumatic Brain Injury (TBI) without any neurological symptoms
 Please reply back accepting or denying requests. Additionally, please attach a LOP if testing is approved!
 ---Administration Axon Medical CentersDallas | Houston | San Antonio | El Paso | AustinPhone: 855-296-6824The information contained in this transmission may contain privileged and confidential information, including patient information protected by federal and state privacy laws. It is intended only for the use of the person(s) named above. On Monday, February 6, 2023, 11:54 AM, Nona Bacote > wrote:
Good afternoon Serena,
I just want to clarify my medical treatment in regards to the two accidents in was involved in.
 On November 8, 2023 I was involved in my first accident and received treatment from Parkridge Medical Center. I have also received additional from heath care from the following places as listed in the order below.
2nd Norton Health Care
3rd Cutting edge
4th Anointed hands
5th Mark Lynn
6th Kort Physical Therapy
All imaging has been done at Innovative Open MRI & Imaging Diagnostic Imaging Center in Lake Mary Florida. I have also received Consultation Aptiv.
On Wednesday, February 8, 2023, I will be going to Mayo Clinic in Rod Chester, New York for more medical treatment.
Farmers Insurance is the insurance company for this accident only. All bills need to be sent to them for payment from the treatment centers above. I?m also requesting policy limits immediately from Farmers.
 On December 9, 2023 I was in my second accident in New York. Where I was in a cab that was reared ended by another automobile. I have only been seen by Cutting Edge and Starlite Chiropractor for medical treatment. In regards to this accident I do have uninsured motorist insurance.
I know this is a lot however, if you feel like all of this is to much for you please let me know as soon as possible.
Muhamad Alif

Please make him aware that a life career plan should be considered with my demand package for medical cost and projection of other health concerns as needed.
As for my second accident, I will have 3 MRI?s taken Tuesday in Lake Mary Florida requested by Dr. William Hwang MD. American transit insurance will be taking care of the bill.
My team of doctors are very concerned about a life care planner determined for medical and rehabilitation care. I would like to know who is going to pay for that associated cost if needed.

Hi Sarena,
I apologize about the delay in getting back to you for dates for Ms. Wickliffe's deposition in the above-matter. We would like to schedule Plaintiff's deposition as well. We have multiple upcoming trials so we are currently scheduling into late April. We have the following dates available:
4/29, 4/30, 5/1, 5/2, 5/6-5/9, 5/20-5/24, 5/27-5/30
Please let me know if any of the above dates work for your office and Mr. Alif and we will confirm with Ms. Wickliffe. Thanks and have a great day!

Case: Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022
Client: Muhammad Alif

__CLIENT CONTACT__
__Details:__ Recvd Client Call - Asking about Deposition on Thursday - Advised 10am - DC Office - He asked about possibly settlement offers at depo - Advised that is highly unlikely as Depositions are still considered Fact Finding - Client reiterated the he will have 2 additional Attorneys present - Lacy T. Smith & Harry O'Donnell - Advised Client again that there is an ethical conundrum with other attorneys being involved - Attorneys should not be speaking to a Represented Individual without the presence of their Retained Attorney - Advised it is likely Mrs. Smith & Mr. O'Donnell will be asked to remain in the hallway & to not be upset if this happens - Discussed with Client depo Dos & Donts - Keep answers short & sweet - Yes, No Answers only when possible - Explained the more you speak, the more they can twist - Client expressed understand & awaiting Depo Conference tomorrow - Client advised he will be flying back from Atlanta tomorrow - Will head to Airport about Noon & will land around 4:30p - Requested Depo Conference prior to Noon 
__Person Making Contact:__ Sarena
__Date & Time__: May 21 2024

CC:
Hi there,
I apologize for the delayed outreach; I unfortunately had a death in the family and have been out of the office intermittently.
One of our associates explained that you received a correspondence rejection letter for patient M. Alif. We are going to reopen this request, as it seems that we would be able to process dates of service 11/8/21-1/18/23. This is up to the date of the signature. If records are needed past the date of signature, we would need an updated authorization to say something along the lines of "I authorize any past, present, or future visits until authorization expires" or "I authorize the release of records created after the date of signature".
I hope this helps to clarify. If you end up receiving a revised authorization, please feel free to send this request to me directly for importing & processing.
If you have any questions, please let me know.

Bryce,
Thank you. As a courtesy, it does not appear that anything has been filed of record. That said, I have no problem if you need to file it today. As you’ll recall from our hearing on your Motion for Extension, Judge Maze said that he would be inclined to grant me a reciprocal extension of 30 days should I ask for one. Given your disclosures, I intend to do so and ask for a continuance of our trial given that extending my deadlines into May puts us very close to the trial date with significant activity to occur in a short period of time. I also intend to request to have your client appear for IMEs given his injury claims. Please let me know if your client will willingly appear on March 28, 2025 for an IME with Edelson Forensics or if I need to compel same. In the meantime, please supplement your discovery responses and provide me dates in April to conduct discovery depositions of your experts.

Case: Muhammad-Alif-MVA-11-08-2022

__Fwd: [EXTERNAL MAIL] muhammad alif 04/16/1961 PDI1739174000__
Faye, would you put this in a letter format on letterhead. It is for Mo's
11/08/2022 case. THen forward it to the below person. THank you.
To Whom It May Concern:
This law firm represents the above-referenced client/patient with regards
to your treatment for injuries pertaining to the automobile accident that
occurred on March 9, 2025.
On behalf of my client, I want to thank you for being so flexible regarding
the financial aspects of your medical treatment. Victims of automobile
accidents are almost always put in a financial bind due to the lack of
cooperation from the negligent party’s and/or their insurance company’s
refusal to accept responsibility and pay for reasonable and necessary
medical treatment. The insurance adjuster for the negligent party may ask
our office to provide medical records for purposes of settling this clear
liability claim. We would appreciate your cooperation in providing us with
those records and bills.
Our law firm will protect your unpaid balance for medical care and
treatment of our client/your patient, out of and to the extent of net
proceeds of any settlement or monetary recovery from the negligent
third-party. “Net proceeds” means the gross settlement amount less payment
of attorney’s fees and attorney’s expenses. Please note that this letter of
protection is not a guarantee of payment, but rather is acknowledge the
fact that we acknowledge and respect the fact that you have agreed to
provide necessary medical treatment and wait until the case resolves for
the client’s bill to be paid.
---------- Forwarded message ---------
